tourBios.otherCarHigh: Earned first-team All-Pac-10 honors during the 2009-10 season playing for the University of Oregon. Won the Duck Invitational with a 7-under 209...Named a Ping honorable mention All-American in 2008-09, the first Oregon player to earn that honor since 1970. Named to the All-Pac-10 second team.
tourBios.personal: Father, Paul, played college basketball for the University of Scranton in Pennsylvania.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T121 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Shot a 6-under, final-round 64 Sunday to win the ATB Financial Classic in his fourth start. His 35-foot, final-round birdie putt, together with opening rounds of 64-66-69, nailed down the victory with a 17-under 263...Finished the season 15th on the Order of Merit to earn an exemption into the second stage of the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament.

2014: Made the cut in seven of 10 starts on PGA TOUR Canada, with three top-10 finishes. Ended the season No. 36 on the Order of Merit...Thanks to a final-round 64, earned medalist honors at the Tour's California Qualifying School to earn exempt status...In his second career PGA TOUR Canada start, posted rounds of 66-69 on the weekend to finish T8 at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open...Thanks to a final-round 67, earned second top-10 finish of the season, at The Syncrude Boreal Open (T10)...Earned third top-10 in sixth start, at the Staal Foundation Open, finishing fourth with rounds of 70-69-70-68, six strokes behind champion Wes Homan's 271 total...Finished T79 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December.

2013: Made the cut in two of six LatinoamĂŠrica starts. Best week was a T9 at the 55 Abierto Mexicano. 

2012: Missed the cut at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Invitational after posting scores of 73-75.

tourBios.otherCarHigh: Earned first-team All-Pac-10 honors during the 2009-10 season playing for the University of Oregon. Won the Duck Invitational with a 7-under 209...Named a Ping Honorable Mention All-American in 2008-09, the first Oregon player to earn that honor since 1970. Named to the All-Pac-10 second team.
tourBios.personal: Father, Paul, played college basketball for the University of Scranton in Pennsylvania...Played college golf at Oregon with fellow Mackenzie Tour player Eugene Wong.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T36th in 2015 at the Nova Scotia Open.
